solution.text:
Let a be the first term and r be the common ratio of the G.P
Sum of first n terms
\(S_n=\frac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r}\)
Since there are n terms from \((n+1)^{th}\) to \((2n)^{th}\) term,
Sum of terms from \((n+1)^{th}\) to \((2n)^{th}\) term
\(S_n^l=\frac{a^l(1-r^n)}{1-r}\)
where, \(a^l=(n+1)^{th}\) term
Thus, required ratio=\(\frac{S_n}{S_n^l}=\frac{a}{a^l}=\frac{a}{ar^{(n+1)-1}}=\frac{1}{r^n}\)
here n= _{r}_

content.text: For the given G.P. _{{p}}_ , _{{p*q}}_ , _{{p*q**2 }}_ ,...the ratio of the sum of first _{r}_ terms to the sum of terms from _{{r+1}}_ to _{{2*r}}_ term is \(\frac{1}{_{q}_^n}\). Find n?
